name: substring* examples
code:
ASSERT substring( val = 'ABCDE' off = 2 len = 1 ) = 'C'.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'ABCD' sub = 'B' ) = 'BCD'.
ASSERT substring_after( val = 'ABCD' sub = 'B' ) = 'CD'.
ASSERT substring_to( val = 'ABCD' sub = 'B' ) = 'AB'.
ASSERT substring_before( val = 'ABCD' sub = 'B' ) = 'A'.

*/*-----------------
* SUBSTRING
*-----------------*/

*/*-----------------
*   SUBSTRING_FROM
*-----------------*/
*//--- sub
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'ABCDEFGH' sub = 'CD' ) = 'CDEFGH'.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'ABCDEFGH' sub = 'H' ) = 'H'.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'ABCDEFGH' sub = 'I' ) = ''.
*//--- regex
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'ABCDE' regex = '..$$' ) = 'DE'.
*//--- case ('X' by default = case sensitive)
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'abcde' sub = 'CD' ) = ''.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'abcde' sub = 'CD' case = '' ) = 'cde'.
*//--- occ (1 by default)
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'abcbcd' sub = 'bc' occ = 1 ) = 'bcbcd'.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'abcbcd' sub = 'bc' occ = 2 ) = 'bcd'.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'abcbcd' sub = 'bc' occ = -1 ) = 'bcd'.
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'abcbcd' sub = 'bc' occ = -2 ) = 'bcbcd'.
*//--- len (unlimited by default, 0 or negative fails)
ASSERT substring_from( val = 'ABCDE' sub = 'B' len = 2 ) = 'BC'.

*/*-----------------
* SUBSTRING_AFTER
*-----------------*/

*/*-----------------
* SUBSTRING_BEFORE
*-----------------*/

*/*-----------------
* SUBSTRING_TO
*-----------------*/
